KnowledgeBase.Title: isBoolean
KnowledgeBase.ArgumentTypes:
Character String Symbol Vector BitVector ByteVector IntVector
FltVector ObjVector Structure Dictionary Directory
Matrix NumMatrix Integer Float Number Complex Boolean

Function.Description: The isBoolean function checks the argument to determine if it is a Boolean object.

Brief.Overview: The isBoolean function checks the argument {obj} to determine if it is a Boolean object. If the object is a Boolean, the isBoolean function returns true. If the object is not a Boolean, false is returned.
Brief.Usage: The isBoolean function is used whenever it is necessary to determine if an object is a Boolean.

Argument.Name: obj
Argument.AISTypes:
Character, String, Symbol, Vector, BitVector, ByteVector, IntVector,
FltVector, ObjVector, Structure, Dictionary, Directory,
Matrix, NumMatrix, Integer, Float, Number, Complex, Boolean

Syntax.Return: Returns true if the object is a Boolean, otherwise false is returned.
